info.title: IA-Connect Web Browser
info.description: IA-Connect is a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform which adds RPA functionality from the Cloud to on-premises virtual machines or over Citrix or Microsoft Remote Desktop (RDS) connections. This is the module for Web Browser automation.

ChromeBrowserMajorVersion.description: The major version of the Chrome browser (e.g. 91) installed in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

post.description: Determines which version of ChromeDriver is suitable for the installed version of Google Chrome in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, checks if a suitable version is already downloaded and, if not, attempts to download a suitable version from Google's ChromeDriver Internet web page.

ChromeBrowserEXE.title: Chrome EXE path
ChromeBrowserEXE.description: An optional path to the Chrome.exe, if this is not installed in the default location (or you are using a Dev or Canary version of Chrome).

ChromeDriverDownloadParentFolder.title: ChromeDriver download parent folder
ChromeDriverDownloadParentFolder.description: The parent folder where all ChromeDrivers are stored locally on disk. Each ChromeDriver is stored in a versioned sub-folder to match the major version of Google Chrome. This folder structure will be checked for a suitable ChromeDriver and, if one is not located, one will be downloaded from the Internet into this folder.

AttemptToLocateChromeDriverURLViaXMLInde.title: Attempt to locate URL via XML index
AttemptToLocateChromeDriverURLViaXMLInde.description: Set to true to attempt to use an XML index to locate the relevant ChromeDriver for download. The 'ChromeDriver root webpage URL' (ChromeDriverRootWebPageURL) will be used to determine which URL to use. Since Google Chrome version 115, Google have stopped updating the XML index and use a JSON index instead.

ChromeDriverRootWebPageURL.title: ChromeDriver root webpage URL
ChromeDriverRootWebPageURL.description: The root web page URL which contains an XML index that can be used to locate the relevant ChromeDriver for download. This defaults to the correct XML index URL on Google's ChromeDriver website, but you can change this if an alternative location is required (for example if Google change the address, or you decide to host it yourself). Since Google Chrome version 115, Google have stopped updating the XML index and use a JSON index instead, making this option redundant unless you have an old version of Google Chrome (or use an alternative XML index).

AttemptToLocateChromeDriverURLViaJSONInd.title: Attempt to locate URL via JSON index
AttemptToLocateChromeDriverURLViaJSONInd.description: Set to true to attempt to use an JSON index to locate the relevant ChromeDriver for download. The 'ChromeDriver JSON index webpage URL' (ChromeDriverJSONIndexWebPageURL) will be used to determine which URL to use. JSON indexes are used for Google Chrome versions 115 and later.

ChromeDriverJSONIndexWebPageURL.title: ChromeDriver JSON index webpage URL
ChromeDriverJSONIndexWebPageURL.description: The URL of a web page JSON index that can be used to locate the relevant ChromeDriver for download. This defaults to the correct JSON index URL on Google's Chrome-for-testing website, but you can change this if an alternative location is required (for example if Google change the address, or you decide to host it yourself). A JSON index is only used for Google Chrome versions 115 onwards.

Prefer64bitChromeDriver.title: Prefer 64-bit ChromeDriver
Prefer64bitChromeDriver.description: Set to true to attempt to download a 64-bit ChromeDriver if one exists. A 32-bit ChromeDriver will be downloaded if a 64-bit one is not available. Note that a 32-bit ChromeDriver works with both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the Google Chrome Browser.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SuitableChromeDriverPath.title: Suitable ChromeDriver path
SuitableChromeDriverPath.description: The path to the suitable version of ChromeDriver for the installed version of Google Chrome in the session where the Agent is running. This was either already present within the download folder or was downloaded from the Internet.

post.description: Searches for a suitable version of ChromeDriver for the installed version of Google Chrome in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

ChromeDriverFolder.title: Chrome driver parent folder
ChromeDriverFolder.description: The parent folder which contains a ChromeDriver folder (which itself contains the ChromeDriver.exe) for the major version of Chrome.

ChromeBrowserEXE.title: Chrome EXE path
ChromeBrowserEXE.description: An optional path to the Chrome.exe, if this is not installed in the default location (or you are using a Dev or Canary version of Chrome).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ChromeBrowserFileVersion.title: Chrome EXE file version
ChromeBrowserFileVersion.description: The version of the Chrome.exe file installed in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

ChromeBrowserMajorVersion.title: Chrome EXE major version
ChromeBrowserMajorVersion.description: The major version of the Chrome browser (e.g. 91) installed in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

SuitableChromeDriverAvailable.title: Suitable ChromeDriver available
SuitableChromeDriverAvailable.description: Returns true if a suitable version of ChromeDriver can be found for the installed version of Google Chrome in the session where the Agent is running.

SuitableChromeDriverPath.title: Suitable ChromeDriver path
SuitableChromeDriverPath.description: The file path to the suitable version of ChromeDriver for the installed version of Google Chrome in the session where the Agent is running.

post.description: Uploads a new version of ChromeDriver from the local system (the digital worker) to the IA-Connect Agent session to be used with Google Chrome.

LocalChromeDriverFilePath.title: Local ChromeDriver file path
LocalChromeDriverFilePath.description: The file path to ChromeDriver.exe in the local session (where the IA-Connect Director is running) for the Chrome browser major version. This will be uploaded to the IA-Connect Agent session and should only be used when running the IA-Connect Agent in a Citrix or RDP session.

Compress.title: Compress
Compress.description: Should the ChromeDriver be compressed when uploading?

ChromeBrowserMajorVersion.title: Chrome EXE major version
ChromeBrowserMajorVersion.description: The major version of the Chrome browser (e.g. 91) installed in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

ChromeDriverRootSaveFolder.title: ChromeDriver remote parent save folder
ChromeDriverRootSaveFolder.description: The file path to the folder where the ChromeDriver should be saved in the IA-Connect Agent session.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Opens the Google Chrome web browser, allowing it to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. If the web browser was opened manually, by another application or using the 'Run Process' action then it can only be automated using UIA actions and not by the actions in this IA-Connect module.

ChromeDriverFolder.title: Chrome driver folder
ChromeDriverFolder.description: The folder path containing the correct version of ChromeDriver.exe for the Chrome browser major version in the IA-Connect Agent session.

KillExistingChromeDriver.title: Kill existing ChromeDriver
KillExistingChromeDriver.description: Should any existing instances of ChromeDriver.exe be killed when Chrome is opened?

UserDataDir.title: User data directory
UserDataDir.description: An optional path to a persistent Google Chrome user data directory to use for your Browser session. This input is blank by default and causes the IA-Connect Agent to use a new temporary browser profile for each browser session, ensuring that each session is clean. If you enter a path to a user data directory, the browser will use this as a persistent profile which is maintained between browser sessions. For example: %LOCALAPPDATA%\Google\Chrome\AutomationProfile.

PrintToDefaultPrinter.title: Print to default printer
PrintToDefaultPrinter.description: Should Chrome print to the default printer in the IA-Connect Agent session automatically without displaying a print dialog? The default printer can be changed using the 'Set default printer' action in the IA-Connect Environment / Session actions.

DefaultDownloadDirectory.title: Default download directory
DefaultDownloadDirectory.description: An optional path to a default download directory where all downloads will be saved to.

DownloadPDFInsteadOfOpening.title: Download PDF instead of opening
DownloadPDFInsteadOfOpening.description: Should PDF files automatically be downloaded instead of opening them?

ChromeDriverLogFilename.title: Chrome driver log filename
ChromeDriverLogFilename.description: An optional path to the location where ChromeDriver log files will be stored.

LocalChromeDriverFolder.title: Local Chrome driver folder
LocalChromeDriverFolder.description: The folder path in the local session (where the IA-Connect Director is running) to the folder containing the correct version of ChromeDriver.exe for the Chrome browser major version. This will be automatically uploaded to the IA-Connect Agent session and should only be used when running the IA-Connect Agent in a Citrix or RDP session.

ChromeBrowserEXE.title: Chrome EXE path
ChromeBrowserEXE.description: An optional path to the Chrome.exe, if this is not installed in the default location (or you are using a Dev or Canary version of Chrome).

IgnoreCertificateErrors.title: Ignore certificate errors
IgnoreCertificateErrors.description: Should Chrome ignore webpage certificate errors?

AdditionalArguments.title: Additional arguments
AdditionalArguments.description: An optional space separated list of additional command-line options / arguments or user profile preferences to send to the browser. Command-line options are in the format --Option while user profile preferences are in the format UserProfilePreference:Preference=Value. Place a space between each separate option and do not use spaces within an option unless required. Put double quotes around an option if it must have spaces in it. For example: The following enables incognito mode (via an argument) and turns off auto saving of passwords (via a user profile preference): --Incognito UserProfilePreference:credentials_enable_service=false.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ChromeDriverPID.title: ChromeDriver process Id
ChromeDriverPID.description: The process ID of the ChromeDriver process that has been launched.

ChromeDriverTCPPort.title: ChromeDriver TCP port
ChromeDriverTCPPort.description: The TCP port that ChromeDriver is listening on to receive requests from the IA-Connect Agent.

ChromePID.title: Chrome process Id
ChromePID.description: The process ID of the Chrome process that has been launched.

ChromeTCPPort.title: Chrome TCP port
ChromeTCPPort.description: The TCP port that Chrome DevTools is listening on, to receive requests from ChromeDriver.

ChromeInstanceUserDataDir.title: Chrome instance user data directory
ChromeInstanceUserDataDir.description: The path to the user data directory being used by Chrome, e.g. 'C:\Users\Robot1\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\User Data'.

post.description: Closes the Google Chrome web browser which was opened using the 'Open Chrome' action.

PurgeDynamicUserDataDir.title: Purge dynamic user data dir
PurgeDynamicUserDataDir.description: Should a dynamic user data directory be purged when closing Chrome? By default this is set to true as a dynamic user data directory is generated when Chrome is not using a specific user profile and is designed for one time use.

PurgeStaticUserDataDir.title: Purge static user data dir
PurgeStaticUserDataDir.description: Should a static user data directory be purged when closing Chrome? By default this is set to false as a static user data directory is used when Chrome is using a specific user profile and can be re-used between Chrome sessions.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Opens the Internet Explorer web browser, allowing it to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. If the web browser was opened manually, by another application or using the 'Run Process' action then it can only be automated using UIA actions and not by the actions in this IA-Connect module.

IEDriverFolder.title: Internet Explorer driver folder
IEDriverFolder.description: This parameter allows you to specify an alternative location for the folder containing IEDriver.dll. By default, IA-Connect handles this automatically so you would only need to use this parameter if directed by Ultima Technical Support.

KillExistingIEDriver.title: Kill existing IEDriverServer
KillExistingIEDriver.description: Should any existing instances of IEDriverServer.exe (legacy) be killed or should any existing IEDriver be unloaded before launching a new instance of Internet Explorer? This should be left as false unless directed by Ultima Technical Support.

KillExistingIE.title: Kill existing IE
KillExistingIE.description: Should any existing sessions of Internet Explorer be killed before launching a new instance?

CleanSession.title: Clean session
CleanSession.description: Should Internet Explorer launch a clean session? This will clear all browsing history and other temporary files before launching.

EnableNativeEvents.title: Enable native events
EnableNativeEvents.description: Should native events be enabled? This is generally more reliable and better simulates user interactions. If set to false, user interactions are simulated by JavaScript events.

WebDriverLogFile.title: Web driver log file
WebDriverLogFile.description: An optional file path to the location where web driver log files will be stored.

WebDriverLogLevel.title: Web driver log level
WebDriverLogLevel.description: An optional number to indicate the level of web driver logging as indicated: Fatal (1), Error (2), Warn (3), Info (4), Debug (5) or Trace (6).

DisableIEFirstRunCustomise.title: Disable IE first run customise
DisableIEFirstRunCustomise.description: Should the first-run customisation dialogs be suppressed? These dialogs can typically interrupt an automated process.

AdditionalArguments.title: Additional arguments
AdditionalArguments.description: Additional command-line arguments to pass to Internet Explorer on launch. For example: -private will open the Browser in Private (Incognito) mode. Use this option at your own risk since the use of custom arguments is not extensively tested or supported.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Closes the Internet Explorer browser which was opened using the 'Open Internet Explorer' action.

UnloadIEDriver.title: Unload IE driver
UnloadIEDriver.description: Should the IE driver be unloaded when IA-Connect Agent closes Internet Explorer? This is typically unnecessary and should only be used if approved by Ultima Technical Support.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Reports whether a HTML element currently exists. This action does not wait for the HTML element.

ParentElementHandle.title: Parent Element handle
ParentElementHandle.description: The parent element handle to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Create handle to element'. If no value or 0 is provided then the whole page DOM structure is searched.

SearchElementHandle.title: Search Element handle
SearchElementHandle.description: The element handle to the target element. This could be located using 'Get multiple element properties' or some other search which returns an element handle. If a handle value (a value of 1 or higher) is entered into this field then all other search criteria are ignored since this handle uniquely identifies an element and hence no other details are required. By default, no value (or 0) is used to specify that an element handle is not being provided.

MaxTextLength.title: Max text length

ReturnParentTag.title: Return parent tag

post.summary: Simulate mouse left click on web element
post.description: Simulates a mouse action by telling the browser that a mouse left click action was performed. This is usually sufficient for the web page to react as expected. If this fails, consider using 'Global mouse left click on element' which moves the mouse and clicks in exactly the same way as a user would.

SearchElementIndex.title: Search Element index

SearchElementMinimumHeight.title: Search Element minimum height

SearchElementBoundingBoxLeft.title: Search Element bounding box left

SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.title: Search Element bounding box right
SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the right side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to 99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxTop.title: Search Element bounding box top

SearchElementBoundingBoxBottom.title: Search Element bounding box bottom

OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.title: Only Element top left needs to be in bounding box
OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.description: Should only the top left of the search element found within the bounding box, or the entire element. By default, this is set to false.

post.summary: Simulate mouse right click on web element
post.description: Simulates a mouse action by telling the browser that a mouse right click action was performed. This is usually sufficient for the web page to react as expected. If this fails, consider using 'Global mouse right click on element' which moves the mouse and clicks in exactly the same way as a user would.

SearchElementHandle.title: Search Element handle
SearchElementHandle.description: The element handle to the target element. This could be located using 'Get multiple element properties' or some other search which returns an element handle. If a handle value (a value of 1 or higher) is entered into this field then all other search criteria are ignored since this handle uniquely identifies an element and hence no other details are required. By default, no value (or 0) is used to specify that an element handle is not being provided.

post.description: Opens a new tab in the browser window. In Internet Explorer, this action opens a new window but the new window behaves as a tab and can be interacted with in the same way as a tab with the 'Get browser tabs' or 'Set browser tab' actions.

URL.title: URL
URL.description: The URL of the page to be opened in a new tab.

SwitchControlToNewTab.title: Switch control to new tab
SwitchControlToNewTab.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will switch control to the new tab. If set to false, control will be kept in the current tab.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NewTabName.title: New tab name

NewTabIndex.description: The tab index of the new tab.

post.description: Sets the active tab and switches the IA-Connect Agent to control this tab so that it can interact with it.

post.description: Closes the current active browser tab. After calling this action the IA-Connect Agent will not switch to a new active tab by default. To re-attach to another tab you will need to the call 'Set browser tab' action before attempting to interact with the page.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Saves the current HTML page to a file on disk.

post.description: Gets all the text on the current page by selecting the entire browser page, copying it into the clipboard in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running and then returning the clipboard contents.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

PageText.title: Page text

post.description: Switches the IA-Connect Agent to controlling or interacting with an alternative frame within a browser page.

ParentElementHandle.title: Parent Element handle
ParentElementHandle.description: The parent element handle to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Create handle to element'. If no value or 0 is provided then the whole page DOM structure is searched.

SearchElementHandle.title: Search Element handle
SearchElementHandle.description: The element handle to the target element. This could be located using 'Get multiple element properties' or some other search which returns an element handle. If a handle value (a value of 1 or higher) is entered into this field then all other search criteria are ignored since this handle uniquely identifies an element and hence no other details are required. By default, no value (or 0) is used to specify that an element handle is not being provided.

SearchElementName.title: Search Element name
SearchElementName.description: The optional HTML name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementID.title: Search Element ID
SearchElementID.description: The optional HTML ID of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementTagName.title: Search Element tag name
SearchElementTagName.description: The optional HTML tag name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementXPath.title: Search Element XPath
SearchElementXPath.description: An optional XPath query to identify the element. Wildcards are supported.

SearchElementClassName.title: Search Element class name
SearchElementClassName.description: The optional HTML class name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementCSSSelector.title: Search Element CSS selector
SearchElementCSSSelector.description: An optional CSS selector to identify the element. Wildcards are supported.

SearchElementIndex.title: Search Element index
SearchElementIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched.

SearchElementMatchValue.title: Search Element match value
SearchElementMatchValue.description: The optional HTML value of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementMatchText.title: Search Element match text
SearchElementMatchText.description: The optional HTML text value of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementType.title: Search Element type
SearchElementType.description: The optional HTML type of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementMinimumWidth.title: Search Element minimum width
SearchElementMinimumWidth.description: An optional minimum width of elements to be returned. By default, this is set to 1 to avoid returning hidden elements which typically have a width of 0.

SearchElementMinimumHeight.title: Search Element minimum height
SearchElementMinimumHeight.description: An optional minimum height of elements to be returned. By default, this is set to 1 to avoid returning hidden elements which typically have a height of 0.

SearchElementBoundingBoxLeft.title: Search Element bounding box left
SearchElementBoundingBoxLeft.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the left side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to -99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.title: Search Element bounding box right
SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the right side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to 99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxTop.title: Search Element bounding box top
SearchElementBoundingBoxTop.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the top side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to -99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxBottom.title: Search Element bounding box bottom
SearchElementBoundingBoxBottom.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the bottom side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to 99999 to return all elements.

OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.title: Only Element top left needs to be in bounding box
OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.description: Should only the top left of the search element found within the bounding box, or the entire element. By default, this is set to false.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ResetExistingValue.title: Reset existing value
ResetExistingValue.description: Should any existing text in the matching element be removed? By default, this is set to true.

PasswordContainsStoredPassword.title: Password contains stored password
PasswordContainsStoredPassword.description: Set to true if the password contains (or is entirely) an IA-Connect stored password identifier, in the format {IAConnectPassword:StoredPasswordIdentifier} or an IA-Connect Orchestrator generic credential, in the format {OrchestratorCredential:FriendlyName}. This stored password could have been generated by the 'Generate password' action, for example.

ParentElementHandle.description: The parent element handle to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Create handle to element'. If no value or 0 is provided then the whole page DOM structure is searched.

SearchElementName.title: Search Element name
SearchElementName.description: The optional HTML name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementID.title: Search Element ID
SearchElementID.description: The optional HTML ID of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementTagName.title: Search Element tag name
SearchElementTagName.description: The optional HTML tag name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementXPath.title: Search Element XPath
SearchElementXPath.description: An optional XPath query to identify the element. Wildcards are supported.

SearchElementClassName.title: Search Element class name
SearchElementClassName.description: The optional HTML class name of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementCSSSelector.title: Search Element CSS selector
SearchElementCSSSelector.description: An optional CSS selector to identify the element. Wildcards are supported.

SearchElementIndex.title: Search Element index
SearchElementIndex.description: If multiple elements match the search, which element (starting at 1) should be matched.

SearchElementMatchValue.title: Search Element match value
SearchElementMatchValue.description: The optional HTML value of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementMatchText.title: Search Element match text
SearchElementMatchText.description: The optional HTML text value of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementType.title: Search Element type
SearchElementType.description: The optional HTML type of the element to search for. This can be discovered via inspection. Wildcards are not supported in this parameter but can instead be used as part of an XPath or CSS selector.

SearchElementMinimumWidth.title: Search Element minimum width
SearchElementMinimumWidth.description: An optional minimum width of elements to be returned. By default, this is set to 1 to avoid returning hidden elements which typically have a width of 0.

SearchElementMinimumHeight.title: Search Element minimum height
SearchElementMinimumHeight.description: An optional minimum height of elements to be returned. By default, this is set to 1 to avoid returning hidden elements which typically have a height of 0.

SearchElementBoundingBoxLeft.title: Search Element bounding box left
SearchElementBoundingBoxLeft.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the left side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to -99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.title: Search Element bounding box right
SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the right side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to 99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxTop.title: Search Element bounding box top
SearchElementBoundingBoxTop.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the top side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to -99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxBottom.title: Search Element bounding box bottom
SearchElementBoundingBoxBottom.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the bottom side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to 99999 to return all elements.

OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.title: Only Element top left needs to be in bounding box
OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.description: Should only the top left of the search element found within the bounding box, or the entire element. By default, this is set to false.

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the web element to exist.

RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.title: Raise exception if web element not found
RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if the web element does not exist after the wait period?

UseExplicitWaitConditionsIfPossible.title: Use explicit wait conditions if possible
UseExplicitWaitConditionsIfPossible.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will attempt to use explicit wait conditions to wait for the element, if suitable for the chosen search properties. If set to false, IA-Connect will always perform a wait loop. This is an advanced setting which influences the code path taken by the IA-Connect Agent.

WaitForSearchElementToBeDisplayed.title: Wait for search element to be displayed
WaitForSearchElementToBeDisplayed.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will additionally wait for the search element to be displayed. Displayed means that the element has been drawn within the browser document, it does not refer to whether it is visible on-screen (for example, it could be scrolled off the bottom of the screen but still be considered as displayed).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementExists.title: Element exists
ElementExists.description: Returns true if the web element exists or false if not.

ElementHandle.title: Element handle
ElementHandle.description: The handle for the matching web element. This can be used as an input to further actions acting on this web element. If the web element was not found, this output will be set to 0.

post.summary: Wait for web element to not exist
post.description: Waits for the specified web element to no longer exist.

ParentElementHandle.title: Parent Element handle
ParentElementHandle.description: The parent element handle to act as the starting point for the search. This can be discovered via Inspection using actions like 'Create handle to element'. If no value or 0 is provided then the whole page DOM structure is searched.

SearchElementHandle.title: Search Element handle
SearchElementHandle.description: The element handle to the target element. This could be located using 'Get multiple element properties' or some other search which returns an element handle. If a handle value (a value of 1 or higher) is entered into this field then all other search criteria are ignored since this handle uniquely identifies an element and hence no other details are required. By default, no value (or 0) is used to specify that an element handle is not being provided.

SearchElementMinimumHeight.title: Search Element minimum height
SearchElementMinimumHeight.description: An optional minimum height of elements to be returned. By default, this is set to 1 to avoid returning hidden elements which typically have a height of 0.

SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.title: Search Element bounding box right
SearchElementBoundingBoxRight.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the right side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to 99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxTop.title: Search Element bounding box top
SearchElementBoundingBoxTop.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the top side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to -99999 to return all elements.

SearchElementBoundingBoxBottom.title: Search Element bounding box bottom
SearchElementBoundingBoxBottom.description: An optional HTML document coordinate value for the bottom side of the bounding box in which the search element should be found. By default, this is set to 99999 to return all elements.

OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.title: Only Element top left needs to be in bounding box
OnlyElementTopLeftNeedsToBeInBoundingBox.description: Should only the top left of the search element found within the bounding box, or the entire element. By default, this is set to false.

SecondsToWait.title: Seconds to wait
SecondsToWait.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the web element to exist.

RaiseExceptionIfElementStillExists.title: Raise exception if web element still exists
RaiseExceptionIfElementStillExists.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if the web element still exists after the wait period?

SearchElementMustBeDisplayed.title: Search element must be displayed
SearchElementMustBeDisplayed.description: If set to true, IA-Connect will only consider the element to exist if it is displayed. Once the element is not displayed, it will be considered to not exist and therefore meet the wait criteria. Displayed means that the element has been drawn within the browser document, it does not refer to whether it is visible on-screen (for example, it could be scrolled off the bottom of the screen but still be considered as displayed).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementExistsBeforeWait.title: Element exists before wait
ElementExistsBeforeWait.description: Returns true if the web element existed before waiting or false if not.

ElementExistsAfterWait.title: Element exists after wait
ElementExistsAfterWait.description: Returns true if the web element existed after waiting or false if not.

post.summary: Get web element at screen coordinates
post.description: Returns the web element located at the given screen coordinates. These will be mapped to browser document window and frame coordinates to obtain the element.

XCoord.title: X coordinate
XCoord.description: The screen X coordinate value (in pixels) where the web element should be searched for.

YCoord.title: Y coordinate
YCoord.description: The screen Y coordinate value (in pixels) where the web element should be searched for.

RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.title: Raise exception if element not found
RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if a web element was not located at the specified location?

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementExists.title: Element exists
ElementExists.description: Returns true if the web element exists or false if not.

ElementHandle.title: Element handle
ElementHandle.description: The handle for the located web element. This can be used as an input to further actions acting on this web element. If the web element was not found, this output will be set to 0.

ElementTagName.title: Element tag name
ElementTagName.description: The HTML tag name of the located element.

post.summary: Get web element at browser document window coordinates
post.description: Returns the web element located at the given browser document window coordinates. This coordinate is in pixels relative to the top-left of the browser document window or frame (if IA-Connect has stepped into a frame).

XCoord.title: Browser document window X coordinate
XCoord.description: The browser document window X coordinate value (in pixels relative to the top-left of the browser document window or frame) where the web element should be searched for.

YCoord.title: Browser document window Y coordinate
YCoord.description: The browser document window Y coordinate value (in pixels relative to the top-left of the browser document window or frame) where the web element should be searched for.

RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.title: Raise exception if element not found
RaiseExceptionIfElementNotFound.description: Should IA-Connect raise an exception if a web element was not located at the specified location?

Workflow.title: Workflow

post.summary: Get web element properties as list
post.description: Returns the properties of a web element as a single line list (single line collection / data table) instead of individual items, this maybe useful depending on how you intend to use the data.

ElementHandle.title: Element handle
ElementHandle.description: The handle for the target web element.

GetHTMLCode.title: Get HTML code
GetHTMLCode.description: Should the HTML code (both Inner and Outer) for the elements be returned?

ReturnValue.title: Return value
ReturnValue.description: Should IA-Connect return the HTML value of the element?

ReturnText.title: Return text
ReturnText.description: Should IA-Connect return the HTML text value of the element?

MaxValueLength.title: Max value length
MaxValueLength.description: The maximum number of characters from the HTML value to be returned. This is useful to limit the amount of data returned if the HTML element has a long value. If set to 0, the entire value will be returned.

MaxTextLength.title: Max text length
MaxTextLength.description: The maximum number of characters from the HTML text value to be returned. This is useful to limit the amount of data returned if the HTML element had a long text value. If set to 0, the entire text value will be returned.

ReturnCoordinates.title: Return coordinates
ReturnCoordinates.description: Should IA-Connect return the coordinates of the element?

ReturnParentTag.title: Return parent tag
ReturnParentTag.description: Should IA-Connect return the HTML tag of the parent of the element?

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ElementPropertiesJSON.title: Element properties JSON
ElementPropertiesJSON.description: The properties of the web element, in JSON format.
